actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 in order to encourage small corporate employers to establish retirement pension plans for their employees and to provide worthwhile benefits for their employees under such plans.
short_title: Small Corporate Employers Retirement Pension Plans Act

summary.text: Small Corporate Employers Retirement Pension Plans Act - Authorizes small corporate employees to establish a qualified trust or annuity plan under the Internal Revenue Code, by complying with the alternative plan which prescribes minimum participation standards, minimum vesting standards, and minimum funding standards different from those presently applicable to qualifying trusts. Allows an employer to take a tax deduction for contributions to an employees' trust or annuity in excess of 100 percent of such contribution, up to a contribution level of $25,000. Makes technical and conforming amendments.

titles.title: Small Corporate Employers Retirement Pension Plans Act

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 in order to encourage small corporate employers to establish retirement pension plans for their employees and to provide worthwhile benefits for their employees under such plans.
